definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: And we sailed thence, and came the next day over against Chios;
sentences.chinese: 从那里开船，次日到了基阿的对面。

sentences.english: 15The next day we set sail from there and arrived off Kios.
sentences.chinese: 从那里开船，次日到了基阿的对面。

sentences.english: He laid himself down under the thwarts and waited, panting.
sentences.chinese: 躺在坐板下面，气喘吁吁地等着开船。

sentences.english: Does he need my help navigating?
Embarkment written two weeks before the scheduled warehouse procedures Ibid .
sentences.chinese: 开船前两周书面定仓，程序同上。

sentences.english: There are more sailings from Huangpu instead of Shantou?
sentences.chinese: 黄蒲开船的班次比汕头多。

sentences.english: 15The next day we set sail from there and arrived off Kios.
sentences.chinese: 从那里开船，次日到了基阿的对面。

sentences.english: Lalor, steamed away from shore leaving sampans full of Chinese soldiers behind.
sentences.chinese: Lalor下令开船抛下满载中国士兵的小船。

sentences.english: I can sail a ship without wind.
I used to drive ship in my hometown. Trust me!
sentences.chinese: 小意思，你别小看我，我在老家就常开船。

sentences.english: If there should be any last-minute change in the sailing time, we'll contact you by telephone.
sentences.chinese: 开船时间假如临时有更改，我们会用电话通知你。

sentences.english: The company advertised the sailing day .
sentences.chinese: 这家公司公布了开船日期。

sentences.english: As the boat started to move, my friend Hong called me outside the cabin.
sentences.chinese: 开船的时候，朋友洪在舱外唤我。

sentences.english: When the boat was about to leave, my friend Hong called me outside the cabin.
sentences.chinese: 开船的时候，朋友洪在舱外唤我。

definition: (of a boat) to reach the shore/to pull toward shore/close to shore/landfall
to charter a ship/to take a vessel on rent
to embark/to travel by ship/to ferry
